snippet: Typically, shares of hot initial public offerings go almost entirely to the biggest clients of the Wall Street banks that oversee the stock sale. But as Susanne Craig and Evelyn M. Rusli report in Friday's New York Times, Facebook's executives and...
abstract: Typically, shares of hot initial public offerings go almost entirely to the biggest clients of the Wall Street banks that oversee the stock sale. But as Susanne Craig and Evelyn M. Rusli report in Friday's New York Times, Facebook's executives and underwriters have discussed raising the number of shares that will go to small investors.

headline.main: Daily Report: Small Investors May Get a Piece of Facebook
